keys.answer_region_no: I haven't been to any of the regions mentioned above
keys.call_to_action_open_source: CovApp open source The CovApp is open source under MIT license. Find the code here and the FAQ here. Create your own version and help fight COVID-19.
keys.call_to_action_widget: Use the CovApp for your doctor's office If you prefer a simple implementation, use our CovApp widget to integrate the app and help as many patients as possible. Find information about implementation here.
keys.cookie_bar_text: With your consent, we will analyze your use of the CovApp to improve the CovApp for all users. If you consent to the transmission of analysis data, please click “Accept”. You can use the CovApp without giving consent to analyze your use of the CovApp. For further information, please visit the
keys.cookie_bar_text_dnt: To offer you a better browsing experience, we use cookies. We respect your "Do not track" browser setting, analyzing is deactivated.
keys.data_privacy_content:
Privacy Policy
(status as of: 27 April 2020)

1. Controller
The responsible controller according to Art. 4 para. 7 of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is D4L data4life gGmbH, Rudolf-Breitscheid-Straße 185–189, 14482 Potsdam, Germany, we@data4life.care.

As long as the data is processed exclusively on the user's device with the help of the installed software, the users themselves are controllers.

2. Data protection officer
You can contact our data protection officer by e-mail (datenschutz@data4life.care) or by sending a letter to our postal address (to the attention of "the data protection officer").

3. Which data is processed for which purposes and on which legal basis?

a. Visiting the website
The CovApp is a web application. When the Web page is called, the following data is automatically transferred to the Web server of the D4L data4life gGmbH:
  • IP address of the device used for the retrieval
  • Web address (URL) of the page from which the file was requested (referrer)
  • Date and time of the request
  • Amount of data transmitted
  • Description of the type of web browser used.
The processing of this browser data, which does not show a clear name of the user, but which nevertheless contains a (pseudonymised) personal reference via the IP address, is technically necessary and is carried out in our legitimate interest in showing you our website and in ensuring the stability and security of the website. The legal basis for this data processing is Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR. The above-mentioned data will not be stored for a longer period of time after use of the app.

b. Filling out the questionnaire and creating a QR code
The CovApp should help you to assess whether there is a need for further clarification regarding a Covid-19 infection. Please note, however, that CovApp does not provide any diagnostic or medical services and expressly does not replace treatment and/or advice from a doctor. You can use CovApp without a registration or any form of user account.

The CovApp contains questions about current symptoms, your recent trips and possible interactions. The answers you give to the questions and the automatically displayed recommendations for action depending on your answers are processed exclusively locally on the device you use (smartphone, tablet or PC); at this stage no data is transmitted to the server. Your answers to the questionnaire are stored local and protected on your device only.

It is possible to summarize the answers and further information you have provided in a QR code after the questionnaire has been completed. This is also done purely locally and without data exchange with a server. At a later point in time, for example when you visit a hospital for an appointment or take advantage of the offer of a video consultation hour, it is possible for you to show the QR code stored locally on your device and to transmit the information contained therein. This makes it easier to collect the necessary medical data and noticeably relieves the medical care.

The legal basis for the disclosure of your health-related data in these cases is Art. 9 para. 2 lit. i GDPR in conjunction with § 22 para. 1 No. c BDSG or, in the case of your expressed consent - which can be revoked at any time - Art. 9 para. 2 lit. a GDPR. If a hospital treatment contract is concluded, the legal basis of the state hospital act applies, e.g. in Berlin it is Section 24 of the Berlin State Hospital Act. From the time of disclosure - and subsequent data processing in a hospital information system - the data protection information provided by the hospital apply.

You can delete the data stored by CovApp on your terminal device at any time by clicking "Delete answers" at the end of the questionnaire.

c. Possible analysis of user behavior and error analysis
You can voluntarily agree to the analysis of your user behaviour and the error analysis serving to improve the offer. For this purpose, a cookie banner appears at the beginning of the visit to the website, which asks for your voluntary consent (linked to your IP address). Sensitive answers to the questions are not recorded for the analysis. The analysis is focused on the evaluation of user data for scientific purposes and to improve the CovApp, i.e. how often the possibility of creating and using the QR Code is used. Your data will be anonymised before use. The legal basis for this is your voluntary and informed consent under Art. 6 Para. 1 lit. a GDPR to the collection and anonymisation of your personal data for use in the relevant analysis. You can revoke your consent at any time with effect for the future. The legality of the processing of your data until revocation remains unaffected. Your consent includes the following:

aa) Analysis of user data for scientific purposes and to optimize the application
The anonymised data obtained from the analysis of your use of the CovApp helps to identify "hot spots" by evaluating time periods, risk factors and whereabouts, among other things. By determining at which point the answering of the questions is frequently interrupted, we can optimize the questionnaire.

This analysis allows valuable conclusions to be drawn for pandemic control. It is not possible for us to draw any conclusions about your person on the basis of the data collected for usage analysis.

The analysis is carried out with the help of "Matomo", a free web analysis software that does not transfer any data to third parties. The following data is collected by Matomo and processed anonymously for the usage analysis:
  • IP address;
  • Date and time of the request;
  • Title of the URLs viewed, URLs of the web pages viewed, URLs of previous web pages (only within the app);
  • Screen resolution, time in your own time zone, time to load the website;
  • Geoinformation: country, region, city, browser language, browser user agent and
  • Events: Click on "Start questionnaire", click on "Next question" for all questions, click on "Print QR Code Click" on "Delete QR Code", Click on "Show questions". All other events, especially events that could allow conclusions to be drawn about given answers in the questionnaire, are not recorded and transmitted.
The above mentioned data is only stored and processed on servers owned and controlled by D4L data4life gGmbH. All servers are located in Germany.

4. No obligation to provide personal data
You are not obliged to provide personal data beyond the above-mentioned information when using the CovApp. You may use the CovApp to its full extent without giving your consent to analyse the use of the app.

5. Recipients / categories of recipients of personal dataAs part of the use of the CovApp, health-related data about you will be disclosed if you allow the QR Code to be read on-site at the hospital. Apart from this, no special categories of personal data are disclosed.

6. Duration of storage / deletion
Your IP address is not stored for a longer period of time. Thereafter - if you have agreed - only data collected for the purposes of pandemic control, scientific purposes and to improve the app will be processed anonymously.

7. No automated decision making including profiling
In the context of the use and possible analysis of the CovApp, no decision is made solely on the basis of automated decision-making - including profiling - that has legal effect on you or that significantly affects you in a similar way.

8. Your rights
In accordance with the GDPR, you have the following rights with regard to your personal data to the extent permitted by law:
  • Right of access (Art. 15 GDPR),
  • Right to rectification (Article 16 GDPR),
  • Right to erasure (Art. 17 GDPR; "right to be forgotten"),
  • Right to restriction of processing (Art. 18 GDPR),
  • Right to object to processing (Art. 21 GDPR)
  • Right to data portability (Art. 20 GDPR).
You also have the right to lodge a complaint with a data protection supervisory authority about the processing of your personal data if you believe that the processing of personal data concerning you is unlawful.
keys.disclaimer_paragraph_1:
Dear User,

The corona virus pandemic is changing dynamically, you can use this application to find out whether it is necessary to see a doctor for health:
  • People who have had contact with infected people
  • People belonging to risk groups and those having pre-existing conditions that may intensify the severity of COVID-19 disease
  • People who could further spread the coronavirus

If you have used the CovApp in the past, you will notice that the assessment questions have changed. We will continue to update our protocols in accordance with relevant authorities and institutional recommendations.

We strongly suggest that you stay at home and do your part to help slow down the spread of the virus.

Legal disclaimer
Usage of this application does not substitute medical treatment by a physician or clinical diagnostics. The CovApp serves to improve the procedures at the health center examination centre and other outpatient clinics in connection with the novel coronavirus SARS-CoV-2. If you currently feel seriously ill, please seek medical help immediately.
keys.disclaimer_paragraph_2: This website uses cookies, which are necessary for the function of the website. Personal data is not stored and no conclusions regarding the identity of the user can be made.
keys.faq_content: About the coronavirus The scientific term for the novel coronavirus is „SARS-CoV-2“. This virus can cause a respiratory disease. The name of this disease is called „COVID-19“. Because the infectious disease COVID-19 has already spread across countries and continents, it's referred to as a pandemic. Transmission The new coronavirus is transmitted via droplet infection. It can directly be transferred between humans, when droplets containing the virus get into the respiratory system after they are absorbed via the lining of the mouth and nose or via the conjunctiva of the eye. But an indirect infection is also possible, when droplets are transmitted via the hands to the mucosa of mouth, nose and eyes. Symptoms occur 5 to 6, at most 14 days, after infection.  Symptoms After an infection with the coronavirus, the disease runs a mild course and is not life-threatening for most people. This extends to pregnant women and children. There can be flu-like symptoms, such as a dry cough, fatigue and fever. Furthermore, some patients suffer from a sore throat, headaches, limb pain and chills. Currently it’s been assumed that 4 in 5 cases run a mild course. Though in some patients the infection can have a serious course, causing respiratory distress and bilateral pneumonia. This mostly affects elderly persons or people with chronic diseases such as cardiovascular diseases, chronic lung disease, diabetes, high blood pressure, or cancer. Those severe cases have to be treated in intensive care in a hospital. Solidarity Although there is a very good healthcare system available in Germany, it is not prepared for a rapid increase in intensive care patients. But if it is possible to prolong an increase in severe cases, treatment of infected patients will continue to be available. This can only be done if every citizen practices social distancing. As a precautionary measure, especially for the elderly generation and the chronically ill, everyone should take the situation seriously and avoid social contact as much as possible. But please, provide for elderly and chronically ill relatives or neighbors and living alone or persons in need with food and daily life essentials. Be considerate and attentive for their needs and worries. Communicate with each other – but stay at least 1 meter apart. Act in solidarity. Protection To slow down the spreading of the virus, avoid direct contact, for example when meeting someone. Wash your hands regularly and thoroughly, at least 20 seconds with soap and water. Keep as much distance as possible when coughing or sneezing – turn away from other people. Sneeze into a sleeve or a tissue, which you throw into a bin immediately. Don’t share something you touched with your mouth, like a glass or a bottle, with someone else. Stay at home. Therapy The therapy of the infection depends on the severity of the disease. Mild cases don’t have to be treated and can get well at home. Severe pneumonia has to be treated, for example with oxygen treatment, fluid substitution or antibiotics to treat bacterial co-infections. This mostly has to be done in a hospital. Vaccination Researchers are currently working on developing a vaccine. Right now, there is no vaccination available which protects against the new coronavirus. Get help Please contact your your country's hotline Emergency Please contact your country's emergency number

keys.input_date_error_future: The date must not be in the future.
keys.input_date_help: Ensure to enter a full date in the DD MM YYYY format that isn’t in the future. For example, 09 03 2020
keys.legal_first_paragraph:
Legal notice

Disclaimer

General notice

The use of this app does not replace medical treatment. If you are currently feeling seriously ill, please seek medical treatment immediately. The digital application is not an application that provides diagnostic services. The application serves to simplify the procedures in care.
keys.q_C0_comment:
Close contact with a confirmed case means:
  • Face-to-face contact for longer than 15 minutes
  • Direct physical contact (shaking hands etc)
  • Being within 1 meter (safe distance suggestion from WHO) of the person for more than 15 minutes
  • Contact with or exchange of body fluids
  • Living in the same apartment
Choose "No" if you have worn adequate protective measures (mask) on contact.
keys.q_C0_text: Have you had close contact with a confirmed case?
keys.q_CZ_text: What day was the last contact?
keys.q_D0_text: Have you been diagnosed with chronic lung disease by a doctor?
keys.q_D1_text: Have you been diagnosed with diabetes by a doctor?
keys.q_D2_text: Have you been diagnosed with heart disease by a doctor?
keys.q_D3_text: Have you been diagnosed with adipositas (obesity) by a doctor?
keys.q_M1_comment: You take or get immunosuppresives after an organ transplant, in the therapy of an autoimmune disease, or during chemotherapy.
keys.q_M2_text: Have you been vaccinated against flu between October 2019 and today?
keys.q_P1_text: Are you 65 years old or older?
keys.q_P2_option1: Living together with family, in a shared flat, or in a supervised community facility
keys.q_P2_text: What is your current living situation?
keys.q_P3_comment: Any care services or support that you provide as part of your work is not included here.
keys.q_P3_text: At least once a week, do you privately care for people with age-related conditions, chronic illnesses?
keys.q_P4_option1: In a public facility (school, day care center, university, community center etc.)
keys.q_P4_option2: No, in none of the above
keys.q_P4_text: Do you work in one of the following areas?
keys.q_S0_text: Have you had a fever (over 38°C) in the past 24 hours?
keys.q_S1_text: Have you had a fever (over 38°C) in the past 4 days?
keys.q_S2_text: What was the highest temperature, approx.?
keys.q_S3_text: In the past 24 hours, have you had chills?
keys.q_S4_text: In the past 24 hours, have you felt tired or worn out?
keys.q_S5_text: In the past 24 hours, have you had body aches?
keys.q_S6_comment:
The question relates to cold symptoms and excludes chronic cough, seasonal or allergy-related cough.
If you have a chronic cough, please compare your current coughing to your regular problems.
keys.q_S6_text: In the past 24 hours, have you had a persistent cough?
keys.q_S7_comment: The question relates to cold symptoms and excludes chronic runny nose, seasonal or allergy-related runny nose. If you have chronic sniffling, please compare your current conditions with your existing problems.
keys.q_S7_text: In the past 24 hours, have you had a runny nose?
keys.q_S8_comment: If you have a chronic bowel disease, please compare your current bowel symptoms to your bowel patterns under your existing medical condition.
keys.q_S8_text: In the past 24 hours, have you had diarrhea?
keys.q_S9_text: In the past 24 hours, have you had a sore throat?
keys.q_SA_text: In the past 24 hours, have you had a headache?
keys.q_SB_comment:
Check the box if you:
  • Become breathless faster than usual or have difficulty breathing with light loads, such as a walk or climbing a short flight of stairs
  • Experience difficulty breathing or shortness of breath when sitting or lying down
  • Have a feeling of breathlessness/shortness of breath when getting up from bed or a chair
If you have chronic lung disease, compare your current breathing problems with your existing breathing problems.
keys.q_SB_text: In the past 24 hours, did you feel that you were more quickly out of breath than usual?
keys.q_SC_text: Have you had any taste and/or smell loss in the last 24 hours?
keys.q_SZ_text: With regard to all questions about symptoms: since when have you had the symptoms you specified?
keys.q_X0_comment:
The question relates to acute or exacerbated symptoms and excludes chronic complaints or seasonal or allergic complaints. If you have a chronic illness, compare your current symptoms with your previous problems to answer the question.

If you do not have any of the symptoms, don't select an entry and continue by clicking the next button.
keys.q_X0_text: Which of the following symptoms have you had in the past 24 hours? (Multiple selection possible)
keys.qr_code_paragraph:
Below, you find a summary of your answers as a table and as a QR code.

Please save the following QR code and the summary of your answers if you received the recommendation to present yourself at a testing site. If possible, print the summary and, if applicable, show it at the testing site.

If you need to leave home: Please keep a distance of at least 1 meter as suggested by WHO from other people, do not touch anything, and try to contain coughing and sneezing without affecting others.
keys.recommendation_case_1_additonal_info:
You had contact with a confirmed case and reported symptoms.

Please contact your local health department or call a local public hotline to learn how the corona virus testing is organized in your area.

According to the recommendations of the WHO, it would make sense for you to be tested. However, there is no entitlement to a test. The decision whether you should be tested is a medical one and may also depend on on-site test capacities.
keys.recommendation_case_1_text:
You had contact with a confirmed case and reported symptoms.

Please contact your local health department or call a local public hotline to learn how to corona virus testing is organized in your area. You can find contact information for referral hospitals on this list Referral Hospital

According to the recommendations of the WHO, it would make sense for you to be tested. However, please check with your local healthcare provider if you can get a test. The decision whether you should be tested is a medical one and may also depend on on-site test capacities.
keys.recommendation_case_2_headline: Please take care of yourself at home.
keys.recommendation_case_2_text:
Since you had no contact with a confirmed case or the contact was more than 14 days ago, an examination for the coronavirus is currently not recommended for you according to WHO.

It is best for you to stay at home, focus on your recovery, and reduce direct personal contacts.

If you belong to a risk group due to your age, your previous illnesses, or your current medication or if you work in the medical field, please note the specific information.

If your symptoms become more severe in the next few days or if you are unsure what to do, please first contact your general practitioner or the medical on-call service
keys.recommendation_case_3_headline: Stay at home and get healthy
keys.recommendation_case_3_text:
Since you had no contact with a confirmed case or the contact was more than 14 days ago, an examination for the coronavirus is currently not recommended for you according to the WHO.

It is best for you to stay at home, focus on your recovery and reduce direct personal contacts.

If you belong to a risk group due to your age, your previous illnesses or your current medication or if you work in the medical field, please note the specific information.

If your symptoms get worse in the next few days or if you are unsure on what to do, please contact your general practitioner
keys.recommendation_case_4_headline: Please stay at home and follow the general hygiene recommendations.
keys.recommendation_case_4_text:
Since you had no contact with a confirmed case or the contact was more than 14 days ago, an examination for the coronavirus is currently not recommended for you according to the WHO.

It is best for you to stay at home, focus on your recovery and reduce direct personal contacts.

If you belong to a risk group due to your age, your previous illnesses or your current medication or if you work in the medical field, please note the specific information.

If your symptoms get worse in the next few days or if you are unsure on what to do, please contact your general practitioner
keys.recommendation_case_5_headline: Follow the general hygiene recommendations and practice social distancing
keys.recommendation_case_5_text:
Currently, you don't need to do anything in particularly, because:
  • You didn't have contact to a verified case.
  • You don't have symptoms.

To keep the risk of infection low, please pay more attention to good hand hygiene.

Avoid unnecessary contacts with other people and stay at home if possible. When you leave the house, maintain a sufficient distance (at least 1 meter) from other people.

If you develop (cold/flu) symptoms in the next few days, you can run the questionnaire again to check which recommendations for action apply in this case.

Find more helpful information below.

keys.recommendation_telemedicine_content: Below you find some links to find out more about the COVID-19 situation reports in Indonesia Indonesia Jakarta Jawa Barat Jawa Tengah DI Yogaykarta Banten Nusa Tenggara Barat (NTB) Kepulauan Riau
keys.recommendation_telemedicine_headline: Some links to find out the COVID-19 situation reports
keys.risk_group: You belong to the risk group According to the criteria of the WHO (age, previous illnesses or current medication) you belong to a risk group. People of the risk group are at increased risk when infected with the coronavirus. The WHO therefore recommends a test for the coronavirus at early signs of a disease. Please call your family doctor or an examination center in your area to find out how a test can be arranged for you.
keys.risk_medical_workspace: You work in the medical field The WHO recommends people working in the medical field to conduct a test for the coronavirus at early signs of illness. Please talk respectively call your employer, general practitioner or an examination center near you to identify how a test can be arranged for you.
keys.risk_spreading_caring_for_relatives: Please discuss how to proceed with your general practitioner and try to maintain a safe physical distance from your relative(s) in care.
keys.risk_spreading_caring_for_relatives_head: You indicated that you take care of one or more relatives.
keys.risk_spreading_living_alone:
We advise you to call a trusted person on a daily basis to discuss your current condition and any potential worsening of symptoms.

Please inquire with neighbors, family members, and friends whether they are able to help you. If this isn't possible, you can contact volunteers in your area or do research on the Internet (e.g., using the "Corona Neighborhood Help" search term).
keys.risk_spreading_living_alone_headline: You reported that you live alone.
keys.risk_spreading_living_together:
Since an infection with the coronavirus cannot be ruled out, please stay in your room if possible as the virus is easily transmitted. In the event of contact, you and your relatives should keep a distance of at least 1–2 m and wear mouth and nose protection. Do not use the kitchen, hallway, bathroom and other common areas more often than absolutely necessary and take your meals separate from one another in terms of time and space. If possible, people with risk factors should not be in the same household with you. These are:
  • people with suppressed immune systems
  • people with chronic basic diseases
  • or the elderly
keys.risk_spreading_living_together_headline: You reported that you do not live alone.
keys.risk_spreading_paragraphs:
When you leave the house, keep enough distance (at least 1 meter) from other people and follow the rules of conduct.

Please avoid unnecessary contact with other people and stay at home if possible.
keys.risk_spreading_workspace_medical: Please inform your employer of your contact or current symptoms and discuss further measures to protect the people around you and your colleagues.
keys.risk_spreading_workspace_medical_headlin: You are working in the medical field incl. nursing
keys.risk_very_ill_above_sixty_five: You reported shortness of breath. Please call your general practitioner or the medical on-call service. If your shortness of breath becomes severe, please seek medical help. Please check in daily with a trusted person about your current condition and any potential worsening of symptoms.
keys.risk_very_ill_below_sixty_five: You reported shortness of breath. Please call your general practitioner or the medical on-call service. If your shortness of breath becomes severe, please seek medical help.
keys.start__sub_headline_5: Also use the CovApp and help fight COVID-19
keys.start_legal_paragraph: This application does not provide diagnostic services. This application serves to simplify the procedures in care.
keys.start_paragraph_1_option_1: Information about COVID-19 health services in Indonesia
keys.start_paragraph_1_option_2: Decision support for doctor's visit or coronavirus test
keys.start_paragraph_2:
The CovApp is a software developed by Charité Germany in cooperation with Data4Life Germany. You can use it to get recommendations for action in just a few minutes. The app asks you several questions including symptoms and potential contacts. Besides recommendations for action, relevant contacts, and structured results, the purpose of the app is to guide you safely through the various health care offers and, if necessary, to show you the way to hospitals or to examination centers. Please note that this app does not provide diagnostic services.

In this way, the CovApp can help you to better assess your medical condition, provide recommendations regarding doctor’s visits or coronavirus testing, and summarize relevant medical information for future doctor’s consultation.

How can I use the CovApp?

1. Start the survey by clicking "Start questionnaire"
The survey contains questions regarding your current symptoms and contact history. Completing the survey takes approximately 5 minutes. Please try to answer the questions as precisely as possible.

2. Survey and recommendations
At the end of the survey, the CovApp summarizes your answers and provides you with a recommendation for action, for example:
  • Advice to contact the public hotline for coronavirus
  • Advice to contact your general practitioner
  • Advice on social distancing
3. Preparation for doctor’s visit
When you're given the advice for a doctor’s visit or a visit to one of the coronavirus testing sites, please bring the QR code or print the summary presented. Some coronavirus testing sites can scan the code so that your answers are made directly available to our medical staff and can be used for your consultation. This helps to speed up the process of the medical interview. If visiting your local physician or any other coronavirus testing site, please print the summary provided and bring it along to your consultation.
keys.start_paragraph_3: The survey is evaluated anonymously and all information is processed on your device (for example your smartphone). None of your answers will be forwarded to us, our server or any third party.
keys.start_paragraph_4:
The use of this app does not qualify as medical treatment. If you currently feel seriously ill, please seek medical help.

You can find a list of the closest referral hospitals in your city
keys.start_sub_headline_3: Which data will be transmitted through the internet?
keys.start_sub_headline_4: If in doubt, call a doctor!
keys.summary_reset_headline: Do you want to do the test again?
